project.teaser: The goal of this proposal is to build the capacity to co-create and foster an inclusive EU SDG driven innovation ecosystem, focused on the greatest social, economic and environmental needs of our time, thereby contributing to the realization of the green and digital...
project.objective: The goal of this proposal is to build the capacity to co-create and foster an inclusive EU SDG driven innovation ecosystem, focused on the greatest social, economic and environmental needs of our time, thereby contributing to the realization of the green and digital transition of Europe. Its aim is to provide capacity-building activities to enable the establishment of SDGs-driven innovation ecosystems across Italy, France Portugal, CEE and Israel. We will foster the existing cross-sector collaboration, within the NAB’s and GSG, between the private (investors, comports, startups, SMEs) public (Governments, EU agencies, development banks), academia (research, knowledge, R&D and social (NGOS, philanthropy, social enterprises) actors as a means to plan the establishment of an interconnected and sustainable ecosystem by delivering new research and data, facilitating knowledge exchange, creating new collaboration and engagement opportunities within existing networks and beyond.
project.title: EU SDG-driven Innovation Ecosystems Stimulating economic growth and addressing innovation support imbalances in Europe and beyond
project.keywords: SDG, ecosystem, EU, CEE, Europe’s green and digital transition

article.title: Creation of an inclusive EU SDG innovation ecosystem

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - SDG-INOV-ECOS (EU SDG-driven Innovation EcosystemsStimulating economic growth and addressing innovation support imbalances in Europe and beyond)
result.teaser: SDG-Driven Tech Innovation Ecosystems is a practice-based international consortium comprising GSG Impact and our National Partners for Impact investing in Israel (IFIE), France (FAIR), Italy (SIA), and Portugal (MAZE). The project also involves ancillary partners in Central...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Five local ecosystem engagement events
result.description: Five local ecosystem engagement events one global dialog session each partner will organize an ecosystem engagement event in which the initial results of research will be presented This event will enable the discussions between representatives from startups SMEs government investor networks etc in Israel Italy France Portugal and a represented CEE country The roundtable results will provide insights about the maturity level and the needs of the local ecosystems and as an extension offer key foundational information and highlight key points that should be considered for the development of the EU SDG driven innovation ecosystem plan so as to meet local needs and address local ecosystems challenges The GSG will host an international roundtable discussion discussing the results and sharing the knowledge of research

result.title: State of play in partner and CEE countries report
result.description: State of play in partner and CEE countries report This document will report the findings of the different research activities that will be conducted in 5 innovation ecosystems and synthesise them into a comprehensive state of play report

result.title: Dissemination toolkit and project’s section on GSG and IFIE website
result.description: Dissemination toolkit and projects section on IFIE and GSG website GSG will allocate a section on the main website in order to inform update on planning progress and share relevant news events activities and knowledge to educate relevant stakeholders on EU SDG driven innovation ecosystems

result.title: Electronic newsletters
result.description: Electronic newsletters - Project Lead will update quarterly on project progress and provide information on the high-level aspect and on all activities and progress of consortium members. In addition, consortium members will utilize their electronic newsletter platform and social media to update on the project as part of the Horizon EU initiative and provide ongoing updates, news, share knowledge and information on activities for engagement with local ecosystems and stakeholders.M3, M6, M12, M18, M24

result.title: EU SDG driven innovation ecosystem final plan
result.description: Task 4.3 Plan delivery process. Lead partner: IFIE will lead this task and prepare the design thinking workshop and all partners will be involved by engaging with relevant stakeholders within their ecosystems. IFIE will develop and plan to be shared and disseminated by GSG and partners in relevant outlets as described in WP3.Delivery involves testing out different solutions at small-scale, rejecting those that will not work and improving the ones that will. In this phase we will share a plan developed in T4.2 with relevant stakeholders within Israel, Italy, France, Portugal and CEE countries, the EU and other GSG countries. The different inputs will be collected and integrated into the final plan with consultancy and guidance of strategic consultancy and then disseminated to all parties in the framework of WP3 in the variety of dissemination and outreach tools mentioned above.

result.title: Challenges and opportunities for collaboration at the EU level report
result.description: Challenges and opportunities for collaboration at the EU level report This document will report the needs preferences barriers and opportunities for collaboration between consortium partners CEE countries and additional key stakeholders for the creation of SDGs driven innovation ecosystem and synthesise them into a report highlighting benefits for all partners This document will be updated at the end of the project

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
